extended: For this episode of Rhythm Roulette, we linked up with Stro Elliot. Stro is best known for his work as one half of the duo The Procussions, as well as his prolific career as a solo beatmaker. Recently, I was tinkering with ways of creating the illusion of depth for mapping water. The gist is that you can use increasing opacity in deeper areas to get the effect of diffused light and reduced visibility. Like in real life.

description: Who's getting rich in rural America?
extended: The Census released data earlier this month showing remarkable gains in income and drops in poverty in 2015. But some reporters noticed that for rural areas specifically, the situation was reversed: The 2015 recovery was leaving rural America behind.

description: Meet Smino, the Rapper About to Put St. Louis Back on the Map | PigeonsandPlanes
extended: Smino has a cold. He’s on a rooftop in Chicago’s West Loop neighborhood doing a photo shoot. In December. It’s that point in a Midwestern winter when there’s enough sun to trick you into not wearing a heavy coat, but you’ll regret that choice the second you step outside.
